msContents.summary: Old Norwegian Homily Book. One of the oldest preserved Norwegian manuscripts, which contrary to its title is in fact a homiletic handbook. The manuscript comprises an original element alongside one or possibly two subsequently inserted additions - fols 1-16 and 69-72. The first initial on fol. 17, spanning 9 lines, is the largest in the entire manuscript, thus it is likely that fol. 17 was originally intended to be the manuscript’s opening page. It is also unconventional for a book of homilies to include two Christmas sermons. The Christmas sermon on fols 15r-16v may as such originally have been intended for another collection of texts entirely and not for that which starts on folio 17 with a sermon (see e.g. Stokkeland 2010, 127-128). An electronic diplomatic edition of the entire manuscript can be accessed on Menota’s website.

msItem.author: Alcuin
msItem.title: Liber de virtutibus et vitiis
Book about the Virtues and Vices
msItem.incipit:
ALquínius litil latr diacn ſæn
dir quæðiu hinum kærſta ſyni ſinum Widoni.
msItem.explicit: í æilifri dyrð faður ok ſonar ok andanſ hælga amen.
msItem.bibl: Flom, Codex AM 619 quarto 515-543:12 With facsimiles of fols 3v, 4r and 15r

msItem.title: Homilies
msItem.bibl: Flom, Codex AM 619 quarto 543:13-681 with facsimiles of fols 3v, 4r and 15r

msItem.title: Sermon on Christmas
msItem.incipit:
GOðer brøðr ly
ðið til hvat hær ſægir á þesse hinni helgu boc
msItem.explicit: Se honum dyrð ok vægr. per omnia secula seculorum amen.

msItem.title: Moral Sermon
msItem.incipit: DEum time et mandata eius obſerua. hoc est omnis homo.
msItem.explicit:
ok os vil giarna hafa med ſer ok ſi
num englum í himin riki.

msItem.title: Sermon on Christmas
msItem.rubric: Jn natiuitate domini nostri Iesu Cristi ſermo
msItem.incipit:
Gvðſpioll ſegia fra iarteinum burðar drot
tenſ vars Iesu Criſt
msItem.explicit:
En hirðar hurfu aptr ok lofaðo guð í ollum
lutum þæim er þeir hǫfðu sét eða hæyrt.

at vér megem
ſia hann konung. dyrðar lifanda ok rikianda í ſinu velde fyr utan enda amen.

msItem.title: Sermon on St Stephen
msItem.incipit:
J Gær heldom vér tiðlegan burðar dag
himna konungs.
msItem.explicit:
ſialfr drotten var Iesus Cristr ſa er með fæðr ok
helgum anda lifir ok rikir guð per omnia ſecula seculorum amen.

msItem.title: Sermon on St John the Evangelist
msItem.rubric: Sermo de euuangeliſtiſ. in die sancti Johannis.
msItem.incipit:
MEð þvi at ver hldum í dag
goðer brøðr hotið Iohannis poſtola
msItem.explicit:
þar er vér megem fagna með þæim oc með ollum guðs hælgum per
infinita ſecula ſeculorum ameɴ.

msItem.title: Sermon on the Prophecy of Joseph
msItem.rubric: Jn die ſanctorum innocentium. Secundum matheum.
msItem.incipit: Sva segir Matheus guðſpialla maðr.
msItem.explicit:
oc með ollum guðſ hælgum
æi liflega utan enda. ameɴ.

msItem.title: Sermon on the Circumcision of Our Lord
msItem.rubric: In circum ciſione domini nostri Iesu Kristi. ſermo.
msItem.incipit:
A þessom dæigi var droten vár Iesus Kristr ſkirðr umm
ſcurðar ſkirn gyðinga
msItem.explicit:
af guði drotne vrum Iesu Kriste þæim er með fæðr ok helgum anda
lifir ok rikir per omnia ſecula ſeculorum amen.

msItem.title: Sermon on the Epiphany of Our Lord
msItem.rubric:
Jn epiphania domini ſermo ne
ceſſaʀia.
msItem.incipit: Htið er vér hldum í dag goðer brøðr
msItem.explicit: ſa er lifir ok rikir per omnia ſecula ſeculorum amen.

msItem.title: Sermon on the Epiphany of Our Lord
msItem.incipit:
Kǽrer brǿðr Matheus guðspiallamaðr
ſegir ſva
msItem.explicit:
nu birtuſc þeſſer lutir aller
er nu ero taldeʀ.

msItem.title: Sermon
msItem.incipit:
Kærer brøðr ec vil ſægia yðr at os er mykil nauð ſýn at
vér hverfim til várs drotens með ollum hug oc hiarta.
msItem.explicit: hvat mono þæir nema brenna æiliflega í hælviti með dioflum.

msItem.title: Sermon on the Purification of the Virgin Mary
msItem.incipit:
Htið ſu er vér
hldum í dag goðer brøðr.
msItem.explicit:
þann er með fæðr
ok helgum anda lifir ok rikir per omnia ſecula ſeculorum. amen.

msItem.title: Excerpt from the New Testament
msItem.incipit:
Þat var a æinni hverri tið þa er droten vár var í hæimi
með mnnum
msItem.explicit: ok þar ſin hag eptir ſcapa bæðe í orðum ok í vercum.

msItem.title: Church Bell Sermon
msItem.incipit:
Nv er at røða umm cloccor þær er
kenni menn ringia í kirkium eða í cloccna huſum.
msItem.explicit: þa ſcal hann lifa méð mér í riki himna.

msItem.title: Sermon on Lent
msItem.incipit: Nv er ſu tið comen at hændi ós goðer brøðr.
msItem.explicit:
ſva
at vér ſem með honum ok hann ſe með os per omnia ſecula ſeculorum ameɴ.

msItem.title: Sermon on Palm Sunday
msItem.incipit:
MEð þvi at nu nalgaſc
tið pinſlar drotenſ varſ Iesu Krist goðer brøðr.
msItem.explicit: ſa er lifir ok rikir með fæðr ok helgum anda per omnia ſecula ſeculorum amen.

msItem.title: Easter Sermon
msItem.rubric: Jn die ſancto paſce ſermo ad populum.
msItem.incipit:
Nv er ós at hendi cumen
goðer brǿðr en hælgasto hotið hotiða
msItem.explicit:
ſa er með fæðr ok hæl
gum anda lifir ok rikir per infinita ſecula ſeculorum amen.

msItem.title: Moral Sermon
msItem.incipit:
Maðr ſcal guði unna fyrir hvetvitna fram af llu hi
arta ok af llum hug ok af llu mægni ſinu.
msItem.explicit:
ſva ſcal ſálo mannz lifa við guðſ orð ok við bø
ner goðar.

msItem.title: Sermon for the Ascension
msItem.rubric: Jn aſcenſione domini nostri Iesu Cristi. Sermo ualde neceſſaria.
msItem.incipit: LEtatus ſum in his que dicta ſunt mihi.
msItem.explicit:
læiði hann os til æilifrar dyrðar með guði fæðr ok
hælgum anda þæim er lifir ok rikir per omnia secula seculorum ameɴ.

msItem.title: Pentecost Sermon
msItem.incipit:
UErbo domini celi
firmati ſunt.
msItem.explicit:
þes er lifir
ok rikir með fæðr ok hælgum anda æin guð utan enda ameɴ.

msItem.title: Stave Church Homily
msItem.incipit:
Salomon konungr gerðe fyrſt
myſteri guði.
msItem.explicit:
þæim er lifir ok rikir guð með fæðr oc anda
hælgum per omnia ſecula ſeculorum. ameɴ.

msItem.title: Sermon on the Meeting of the Church Assembly
msItem.rubric: Jn dedicatione ecclesie. ſermo ad populum.
msItem.incipit:
Os er mykil þorf goðer vinir at gefa gum at criſtnum
dome vrum.
msItem.explicit:
ok late os þar ve
ra med ſér ok ſinum hælgum mnnum eiliflega utan enda ameɴ.

msItem.title: Admonition
msItem.incipit:
Aller ſculum vér at því hyggia
hverſu vér varum borner í hæim þenna.
msItem.explicit: ſva at á þvi værðr alldrigi endiʀ.

msItem.title: In inventione sancte crucis sermo
msItem.incipit:
EPtir pinſl drotenſ vart Iesu Kriſti þa er cri
ſtnir menn toco at gofga pínſl hans.
msItem.explicit:
droten vár Iesu Krist honum ſe dyrð ok végr með fæðr
ok anda helgum per omnia ſecula ſeculorum ameɴ.

msItem.title: Sermon on St John the Baptist
msItem.incipit: Bvrðartið Iohanniſ baptiſte er af þvi hotidlega haldenn
msItem.explicit:
með almatkom guði ok hinum hæl
ga iohanne baptiſta er ver holdum hotið i dag ok ollum hælgum per omnia ſecula ſeculorum amen.

msItem.title: Passio Olavi
msItem.rubric: Jn die ſancti Olaui ʀegiſ et martiʀis.
msItem.incipit:
NOrðarla ligr land þat
í hæimſ bygð þeſſe er Noregr hæitir.
msItem.explicit:
Nu er yðr cunt gort hveria
pinſl hinn hælgi Oláfr konungr þolðe fyrir guðſ ſakar í þema hæimi.

msItem.title: Miracula Olavi
msItem.rubric:
Her ſegir fra jartæinum hinſ
hælga Olafs konungſ.
msItem.incipit:
Nv ſcal þvi lyſa hværiar iartæiniʀ
almatigr guð hefir gort
msItem.explicit:
ſa er lifir með fæðr ok andanom hælga. ríkir
ok rǽðr æin guð utan enda yfir verold veralda. ameɴ.

msItem.title: Sermon on the Virgin Mary
msItem.incipit:
Eɴ hælga maria mær moðer drotenſ várſ var
ens bæzta kyns komen fra Abraham ok ór kyni Da
uiðs konongs.
msItem.explicit:
ok ſtyrki ós til viðr ſió ſynda at vér me
gem með guði vera ok guð með ós per omnia ſecula ſeculorum. ameɴ.

msItem.title: In exaltione sancte crucis
msItem.incipit: COſdroe hét konongr hæiðin ut á Serc lande
msItem.explicit:
ok tacn hæilagſ croſ
til æilifra fagnaða ſa er lifir ok rikir guð per omnia ſecula ſeculorum amen.

msItem.title: Admonition, Part 1
msItem.note: Continues after the text of the subsequently inserted quire.
msItem.rubric: Admonitio ualde neceſſaria. Sanctorum angelorum. in die sancti Michaelis.
msItem.incipit:
HOtið ſu er vér hldum í dag er ſætt til dyrðar ollum
guðſ englum
er castat er brauðe í vín. merkir þat er ond Crists vitiaðe licama hanſ
msItem.explicit: eftir up riſo hanſ ok allt til upſtigningaʀ hanſ.

msItem.incipit:
MESSO hald ſette droten Iesus þa er hann gerðe or brauðe ok or vine hold
ſitt ok bloð
msItem.explicit: ſva ſem nu halda fleſtir menn á latino tungo alla.

msItem.incipit: NU HǾFER oſſ at ſcynia hvaðan af hvige ſe nafn gefet.
msItem.explicit:
Af þvi
er at nóne meſſa ſungen. at Cristr andaðeſc at none á croſſenom helga.

msItem.incipit:
GELAGJUS pafi ſa er nestr var fyrir Gregorium
bauð þat at .ix. ſcylðe prefatior hafa
msItem.explicit: Adrer með honom carl maðr ok kona.

msItem.title: Sermon on Doomsday
msItem.incipit: GUðſ friðr ſe með ollum yðr bǽðe karlom ok conom.
msItem.explicit: Oc enn ognar os vár

msItem.title: Admonition, Part 2
msItem.note: A continuation of the text on fol. 68v
msItem.explicit:
þa mo
num vér æignasc himnescan fagnað með guði ok með hans englum per omnia secula
ſeculorum amen.

msItem.title: Sermon for All Saints Day
msItem.incipit:
Sva er ſagt á bócum
at hæilagr Bonefatius pafe er hinn fiorðe var fra
Gregorio let kirkiu vigia í Ruma borg
msItem.explicit:
þann er lifir ok rikir guð með
fæðr ok hælgum anda per omnia ſecula ſeculorum. ameɴ.

msItem.title: Sermon on Tithe
msItem.incipit: Goðer vínir þér megoð hæyra hvat bóc ſegir
msItem.explicit: ok ǽ man vera utan enda ameɴ.

msItem.title: Viðræða líkams ok sálar einn laugardag at kveldi
Un samedi par nuit
msItem.incipit: Ein lgar dag at kveldi ſvaf ec í hvilo mínni.
msItem.explicit:
en þat
stoðaðe henne ecci. þvi at dómr hennar vár þa loken.
msItem.bibl: Widding & Bekker-Nielsen, A Debate of the Body and the Soul in Old Norse Literature 280-289 Ed. N.

msItem.title: The Lord’s Prayer with Explanation
msItem.incipit: VEr ſyngium pater noster qui es in celis. Ðat er sva a vára tungu.
msItem.explicit:
ok með mycclum fagnaðe er
þar ſcalum við vera. amen.

foliation.p: The manuscript is foliated in red ink and paginated in pencil and/or dark ink on the outer top corners of the leaves.

condition.p: Parts of the extremities of fols 3 and 59 have been torn out. There are lacunae after fols 49, 50, 62 and 68. Fols 69-72 were inserted to fill a lacuna. The green colour of the initials has, in some places, corroded the parchment. Notwithstanding this, the manuscript is remarkably well preserved.

layout.p: Written in long lines with 29-32 lines to a page, though most commonly 30. Ruled lines. Red rubrics, coloured initials in red, green and blue.

handDesc.summary:
The number of scribes who worked on the manuscript, and which scribes wrote which sections, are matters of debate.
Kålund (Catalogue) assumes two scribes, as does Unger (Unger 1864, iv).
Hægstad (Hægstad 1917, 102), Indrebø (Indrebø, *6) and Wadstein (Wadstein 1890, 1) among others are in agreement that the manuscript was written by three scribes, while
Flom (Flom 1929, 35), Knudsen (Knudsen 1952, 8) and Seip (Seip 1954, 6). A more detailed, schematic overview can be found in Stokkeland 2010, 116.

handNote.p: The most recent research on the manuscript (Gullick 2010, 77-78, Stokkeland 2010, 128), published in the anthology Vår eldste bok: Skrift, miljø og biletbruk i den norske homilieboka, concludes that the entire book, including the subsequently inserted folios, were written by just one scribe.

However, the scribe’s hand exhibits variation and inconsistency and the script of 16v has a different character to that of 17r. Another marked shift in the character of the scribal hand, along with a change of pen and ink, can be observed on folio 78v: 25-26.

decoNote.p: Large, decorated initials (spanning 3-9 lines, most commonly 5 lines) with multicoloured staves and bows. Many of the initials extend into the margin, with a stave typically elongated. They are either red, green and blue; red and blue; or green and red. Examples can be found on folios 55v and 56v.

Gullick (Gullick 2010) has argumented that the motifs and decorative elements of the initials are of the same type as typically appear in Romanesque European manuscripts, such as the ‘split-petal’ motif known in particular from manuscripts from northern England from the mid- to late-12th century.

additions.q: In parts of the manuscript the scribe has added marginalia, e.g. on fols 8v, 14v, 36v-38r and 45. The lacunae are indicated by short notes on the bottom margins of the preceding verso-sides.
additions.p:
>On an inserted paper leaf, which is now at the back of the codex, Konráð Gíslason added the note concerning fols 69-72, which were inserted to fill a lacuna. The note reads: Sequentia qattror folia membranea, quorum singulae paginae - praeter
ultimam - lineas 31 continent, male hor loco injecta sunt, in lo
cum unius folii perditi, cujus argumentum expleri potest ex duo
bus foliis pervetustis, quae in 257 form. max. inventiuntur.
Die 23. Sept. 1843. K.G.

origin.p: The manuscript was written in Norway in the beginning of the thirteenth century ( Hægstad 1907 41 og Haugen & Ommundsen 2010, 12). Some scholars, including Kålund (KatalogII32) and Gullick (Gullick 2010, 98) are however of the view that the manuscript can be dated to around the year 1200.

The Benedictine monastery Munkeliv in Bergen and the chapter house in are mentioned as two possible scriptoria where the manuscript could have been written. Haugen and Ommundsen (Haugen & Ommundsen 2010, 12) however, citing Gunnes (Gunnes 1971, 16), refute the theory that the manuscript was written at a Benedictine monastery, but nonetheless agree that the manuscript was most likely produced in Bergen.

acquisition.p:
Árni Magnússon acquired the manuscript in Norway, cf. his note in AM 435 a 4to, fol. 23v: Eg hefi eignast bokina i Noregi, og
þar synest hun ritud ad vera..

source.p: Catalogued and validated 21 January 2008 by Silvia Hufnagel.

list.item: Digital photographs, hard disk 1, from 9 August 2005 (fols 47r, 47v, 56v).
Digital photographs, hard disk 1, from 15 March 2006 (fols 55v-56r, 56v-57r, portraits: front, back, inside of binding).
